meanings.definition: A person or thing that toots.
meanings.sent1: The little boy with the red toy car is the tooters in the playground.
meanings.sent2: The train whistle is a loud tooters that can be heard from far away.
meanings.sent3: The tooters in the marching band accidentally honked instead of tooting.
meanings.sent4: The tooters in the orchestra played a symphony of beautiful sounds.
meanings.sent5: The tooters on the ship signaled the start of the race with a loud blast.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a musical instrument, especially a trumpet or horn.
meanings.sent1: At the jazz club, the musician played the tooters with skill and passion.
meanings.sent2: The marching band featured several tooters that added a lively tune to the parade.
meanings.sent3: The tooters in the brass section shone brightly under the stage lights.
meanings.sent4: The tooters in the symphony orchestra harmonized beautifully with the strings.
meanings.sent5: The tooters in the school band practiced diligently to perfect their performance.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a person who drinks alcohol excessively.
meanings.sent1: After the party, the tooters stumbled out of the bar, laughing loudly.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends jokingly called him the tooters because of his love for beer.
meanings.sent3: The tooters at the pub were always the last ones to leave at closing time.
meanings.sent4: His friends teased him for being the tooters of the group, always with a drink in hand.
meanings.sent5: The tooters at the party were having a great time, but they needed a ride home.
